keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Such information, if provided sooner, could have helped health officials save the life of the man, first treated at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston, N.J.

headline.print_headline: Care for Lassa Fever Victim Is Detailed
headline.main: Hospital Says Man Who Died of Lassa Fever Initially Didn’t Disclose Trip to Africa

snippet: Such information, if provided sooner, could have helped health officials save the life of the man, first treated at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston, N.J.
abstract: St Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston, NJ, identifies itself as hospital that released man who later died of Lassa fever, rare disease he may have contracted in Liberia; says man delayed disclosing his travel history, lapse that may have contributed to his death; situation exposed shortcomings of a surveillance system set up to monitor dangerous diseases.
